item.title: CVE-2020-36744|2024-08-04T17:37:07.445Z -- wpdevteam -- notificationx%20%E2%80%93%20best%20fomo%2C%20social%20proof%2C%20woocommerce%20sales%20popup%20%26%20notification%20bar%20plugin%20with%20elementor
item.description: The NotificationX plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery in versions up to, and including, 1.8.2. This is due to missing or incorrect nonce validation on the generate_conversions() function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to generate conversions via a forged request granted they can trick a site administrator into performing an action such as clicking on a link.

item.title: CVE-2024-5571|2024-08-01T21:18:06.783Z -- wpdevteam -- embedpress%20%E2%80%93%20embed%20pdf%2C%20google%20docs%2C%20vimeo%2C%20wistia%2C%20embed%20youtube%20videos%2C%20audios%2C%20maps%20%26%20embed%20any%20documents%20in%20gutenberg%20%26%20elementor
item.description: The EmbedPress – Embed PDF, Google Docs, Vimeo, Wistia, Embed YouTube Videos, Audios, Maps & Embed Any Documents in Gutenberg & Elementor plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the 'url' attribute within the plugin's EmbedPress PDF widget in all versions up to, and including, 4.0.1 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-6557|2024-08-01T21:41:03.524Z -- wpdevteam -- schedulepress%20%E2%80%93%20auto%20post%20%26%20publish%2C%20auto%20social%20share%2C%20schedule%20posts%20with%20editorial%20calendar%20%26%20missed%20schedule%20post%20publisher
item.description: The SchedulePress – Auto Post & Publish, Auto Social Share, Schedule Posts with Editorial Calendar & Missed Schedule Post Publisher plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Full Path Disclosure in all versions up to, and including, 5.1.3. This is due the plugin utilizing the wpdeveloper library and leaving the demo files in place with display_errors on. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to retrieve the full path of the web application, which can be used to aid other attacks. The information displayed is not useful on its own, and requires another vulnerability to be present for damage to an affected website.

item.title: CVE-2024-3018|2024-08-01T19:32:42.518Z -- wpdevteam -- essential%20addons%20for%20elementor%20%E2%80%93%20best%20elementor%20templates%2C%20widgets%2C%20kits%20%26%20woocommerce%20builders
item.description: The Essential Addons for Elementor plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 5.9.13 via deserialization of untrusted input from the 'error_resetpassword' attribute of the "Login | Register Form" widget (disabled by default). This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with author-level access and above, to inject a PHP Object. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it could allow the attacker to delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code.

item.description: The SchedulePress – Auto Post & Publish, Auto Social Share, Schedule Posts with Editorial Calendar & Missed Schedule Post Publisher plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Full Path Disclosure in all versions up to, and including, 5.1.3. This is due the plugin utilizing the wpdeveloper library and leaving the demo files in place with display_errors on. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to retrieve the full path of the web application, which can be used to aid other attacks. The information displayed is not useful on its own, and requires another vulnerability to be present for damage to an affected website.
